thread.title: A footballer born AFTER the 1999 Champions League final just started a Champions League match
thread.title_full: A footballer born AFTER the 1999 Champions League final just started a Champions League match

author: Richard Innes
title: A footballer born AFTER the 1999 Champions League final just started a Champions League match
text:
A footballer born AFTER the 1999 Champions League final just started a Champions League match Kai Havertz of Leverkusen just made a lot of people feel very, very old Share The lad on the left is about to make you realise how ancient you are (Photo: Getty Images) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
The 1999 Champions League Final is etched into the memories of most football fans. 
Regardless of who you support, you almost certainly remember exactly where you were when Manchester United scored those two late goals ("AND SOLSKJAER HAS WON IT!") to beat Bayern Munich. 
It was, undoubtedly, the most dramatic, famous finish there has ever been to a Champions League game. If you were old enough to watch it, you will never forget it. What a game… (Photo: Allsport) 
Which brings us to Bayer Leverkusen midfielder Kai Havertz. 
You may not know an awful lot about Havertz, so let us give you the big details. Kai Havertz - as young as he looks (Photo: Rex Features) 
Havertz is 17 years old. He's a midfielder. He is a regular for Germany under-17s. He started for Leverkusen in their 4-2 defeat to Atletico Madrid in the Champions League Last 16. And, most significantly for this story, he was born on 11 June 1999. 
That epic Champions League final between United and Bayern was played on 26 May 1999. 
Which means Havertz WAS NOT EVEN BORN when Man United sealed their unique treble. "Football, eh? Bloody hell…" (Photo: AllsportUK) 
If that disturbing fact doesn't make you feel ancient, this should just about finish you off. 
Kylian Mbappe is the young Monaco striker/new Thierry Henry who is currently the talk of European football after his stellar Champions League performance against Man City. Aged just 18, he was born on 20 December 1998. Kylian Mbappe: young. Very, very young (Photo: Getty Images) 
That means he was born AFTER Michael Owen announced himself to the world with his 1998 World Cup wonder goal against Argentina. Michael Owen becoming Michael Owen at France 98 (Photo: Getty) Cut to any football fan aged 30+ right now… Like us on Facebook
